channel.title: How can i host a dedicated server?
channel.description:
Well i want to host my RS server remotly because my internet connection is to slow. I was wondering though, how do i do it?
Do just purchase webhosting from a site? but then how do i get my server running on that host? :) im not sure how it really works, how is dodian.com hosted? i dont think its on Wintens own pc.
If you dont understand what im asking just post and ill try and explain it better
P.S I wasnt sure where to post this so if its in the wrong place feel free to move it
Thanks in advance! ;D

item.title: How can i host a dedicated server?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:158365”][quote author=Stanyer link=topic=215832.msg1881489#msg1881489 date=1195085624]
Eek you bought a linux one?
[/quote]

You would have to be an idiot to use something else besides Linux or FreeBSD as a server.

You have to buy a dedicated server (or VPS). Then you have to install java, then you just ssh in and start her up.

I bought a VPS, how do i install Java on it? Also, what is best to use for SSH?

From windows use PuTTY as an ssh client, and the way you install java differs depending on what type of operating system you have, either ask your host how to do it (sometimes they will do it for you) or figure out what kind of OS you have and search on google. You can post back here if you have problems.[/quote]

Lawl.

I use a windows VPS i chose it over linux, and it holds 200 - 250 players no lag so um.

Read full topic
item.source: How can i host a dedicated server?

item.title: How can i host a dedicated server?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Hosting it on a dedicated server may not make a huge amount of difference, since if you are using one of the current bases some if not most of your problems will lie in the way the server is programmed.

Read full topic

item.title: How can i host a dedicated server?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You would have to be an idiot to use something else besides Linux or FreeBSD as a server.

[quote=“gigabyt3r, post:10, topic:158365”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=215832.msg1881247#msg1881247 date=1195043459]
You have to buy a dedicated server (or VPS). Then you have to install java, then you just ssh in and start her up.
[/quote]
I bought a VPS, how do i install Java on it? Also, what is best to use for SSH?[/quote]

From windows use PuTTY as an ssh client, and the way you install java differs depending on what type of operating system you have, either ask your host how to do it (sometimes they will do it for you) or figure out what kind of OS you have and search on google. You can post back here if you have problems.

Read full topic

item.title: How can i host a dedicated server?
item.dc:creator: @gigabyt3r gigabyt3r
item.description:
@gigabyt3r wrote:

Alright thanks so much for helping me… ill check vpsland.com out

EDIT: I was just looking and its $15.99 per month for a server with 192 MB dedicated RAM. 192 MB is extremly low… how many clients could connect to a server that size? Im not sure which package i need

EDIT2: Holy fucking shit i just found a dedicated server for $3,500 per MONTH and it only has 1GB RAM…this stuff is more expensive than i though

Read full topic
